title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 10.

questions.question: Where did Rehoboam go to be made king by all Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Shechem
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:1 states that Rehoboam went to Shechem because all Israel had come there to make him king.

questions.question: Who returned from Egypt when he heard that Rehoboam was to be made king?
questions.correctAnswer: Jeroboam
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:2 says Jeroboam, son of Nebat, returned from Egypt when he heard about Rehoboam.

questions.question: What did the people ask Rehoboam to do regarding the yoke their father put upon them?
questions.correctAnswer: Ease somewhat the grievous servitude
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:4 records the people asking Rehoboam to ease the grievous servitude of his father.

questions.question: How long did Rehoboam tell the people to come back after he heard their request?
questions.correctAnswer: Three days
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 10:5, Rehoboam says to come again after three days.

questions.question: From whom did Rehoboam first seek counsel about how to answer the people?
options: The young men raised with him
questions.correctAnswer: Old men who served Solomon
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:6 shows Rehoboam consulting the old men who served Solomon for advice.

questions.question: What advice did the old men give Rehoboam about how to treat the people?
options: Be kind and please them with good words
questions.correctAnswer: Be kind and please them with good words
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:7 states the old men advised kindness and good words to keep the people as servants.

questions.question: Who gave Rehoboam the advice to add to the people's yoke and chastise them with scorpions?
options: The young men brought up with him
questions.correctAnswer: The young men brought up with him
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:8-11 records that Rehoboam ignored the old men and took counsel from the young men who advised making the yoke heavier.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Rehoboam said, 'My little finger shall be thicker than my father's ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: loins
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:10 records Rehoboam saying his little finger shall be thicker than his father's loins.

questions.question: True or False: Rehoboam accepted the counsel of the old men and lightened the people's burden.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:13-14 shows Rehoboam rejected the old men’s counsel and added to the people's yoke.

questions.question: What was the reason given for Rehoboam not listening to the people according to 2 Chronicles 10:15?
options: It was the cause of God to fulfill His word
He wanted to be a harsh king
questions.correctAnswer: It was the cause of God to fulfill His word
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:15 explains that Rehoboam's refusal was to fulfill God's word spoken through Ahijah.

questions.question: What did the people of Israel say to Rehoboam when he refused to lighten their yoke?
options: What portion have we in David? To your tents, O Israel!
questions.correctAnswer: What portion have we in David? To your tents, O Israel!
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:16 records the people's reply rejecting David's house and returning to their tents.

questions.question: True or False: Rehoboam reigned over all Israel after the people’s rebellion.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:17 states Rehoboam reigned only over the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah.

questions.question: What happened to Hadoram, the officer sent by Rehoboam over the tribute?
options: He was stoned to death by the children of Israel
He was honored by the people
questions.correctAnswer: He was stoned to death by the children of Israel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:18 records that Hadoram was stoned to death by the children of Israel.

questions.question: True or False: The rebellion of Israel against the house of David ended shortly after Rehoboam’s reign began.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:19 says that Israel rebelled against the house of David to this day, implying a lasting rebellion.

questions.question: Who was the prophet mentioned as having spoken God's word to Jeroboam?
questions.correctAnswer: Ahijah the Shilonite
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:15 mentions Ahijah the Shilonite as the prophet who spoke God's word to Jeroboam.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 10 teach us about the importance of seeking wise counsel in decision-making?
options: Rehoboam sought counsel from both old and young men but chose the young men's advice
Rehoboam ignored all counsel and acted on his own
Rehoboam only asked the old men for advice and followed it
Rehoboam asked the people directly and followed their wishes
questions.correctAnswer: Rehoboam sought counsel from both old and young men but chose the young men's advice
questions.explanation: Rehoboam first consulted the old men who advised kindness (10:6-7), but he rejected their advice and instead followed the young men's harsher counsel (10:8-11). This shows the importance of evaluating counsel carefully and choosing the wise and humble path.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with patience and asks what the Bible says about responding to pressure. What does 2 Chronicles 10 teach about the consequences of harsh leadership?
options: Harshness can cause division and rebellion among God's people
Harsh leadership always leads to greater respect
Being strict is the best way to gain loyalty
questions.correctAnswer: Harshness can cause division and rebellion among God's people
questions.explanation: Rehoboam's harsh response to the people's request led to the division of Israel and rebellion (10:13-19). This illustrates that harshness or lack of empathy in leadership can fracture unity and faithfulness.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 10, what biblical truth can we share about humility when facing tough decisions?
options: Humility includes heeding wise and experienced counsel
Humility means always doing what others want
Humility is unnecessary if you are king
questions.correctAnswer: Humility includes heeding wise and experienced counsel
questions.explanation: The older men offered wise advice to be kind and please the people (10:7), but Rehoboam rejected it. This shows that humility involves listening to experienced guidance and not relying solely on one’s own judgment.

questions.question: What does the rebellion of Israel against Rehoboam teach about obedience to God's word and leadership?
options: Disobedience to God's guidance leads to division
questions.correctAnswer: Disobedience to God's guidance leads to division
questions.explanation: The chapter explains that the rebellion was 'for the cause was of God' to fulfill His word through Ahijah (10:15), showing that ignoring God’s will can bring about consequences such as division and broken fellowship.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 10 instruct us about stewardship and leadership responsibilities?
options: Leaders should serve with kindness and lighten burdens
Leaders should increase burdens to show power
Leaders should focus only on their own interests
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders should serve with kindness and lighten burdens
questions.explanation: The people requested Rehoboam to lighten the heavy yoke put on them by Solomon (10:4). The old men’s counsel was to please the people kindly (10:7), teaching that stewardship involves caring for others rather than harshness.

questions.question: What practical lesson can a believer learn from Rehoboam’s failure to listen to the older men’s advice?
options: Ignoring wise counsel can lead to personal and communal failure
Older people’s advice is outdated and should be ignored
Young people’s advice is always better
Leadership decisions should be made quickly without advice
questions.correctAnswer: Ignoring wise counsel can lead to personal and communal failure
questions.explanation: Rehoboam ignored the wise counsel of the experienced elders and followed the young men's advice, resulting in division and rebellion (10:8-14). This shows the importance of valuing experienced wisdom.

questions.question: True or False: Rehoboam’s harsh response to the people was in line with God’s plan as revealed by the prophet Ahijah.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 15 explains that the king’s refusal to listen was 'for the cause was of God' to fulfill His word through Ahijah, indicating that even disobedient actions may fulfill God's sovereign purposes.

questions.question: How can 2 Chronicles 10 guide us in practicing forgiveness and reconciliation within church or family conflicts?
options: Ignoring harshness and seeking to ease burdens fosters unity
Responding harshly to conflict resolves issues quickly
questions.correctAnswer: Ignoring harshness and seeking to ease burdens fosters unity
questions.explanation: The chapter shows that harshness caused division (10:13-16), while the older men’s advice to be kind and please the people would have helped maintain unity (10:7). Forgiveness and gentleness promote reconciliation.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with pride in their leadership role. Based on 2 Chronicles 10, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Pride can lead to rejecting good counsel and cause division
Pride is necessary for strong leadership
Pride ensures success in all situations
Pride helps maintain authority and obedience
questions.correctAnswer: Pride can lead to rejecting good counsel and cause division
questions.explanation: Rehoboam’s pride caused him to reject wise counsel and act harshly, leading to rebellion (10:8-14). This warns believers against pride and encourages humility.

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 10 teach about perseverance through trials when leadership fails us?
options: God’s purposes prevail even when leaders fail
Failure means God has abandoned His people
We should rebel against all authority
Trials show that God is not in control
questions.correctAnswer: God’s purposes prevail even when leaders fail
questions.explanation: Though Rehoboam’s leadership led to division, verse 15 shows God’s sovereign plan was being fulfilled, teaching believers to trust God’s purpose despite human failure.

questions.question: True or False: The people of Israel accepted Rehoboam’s harsh rule and remained united under his leadership.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The people rejected Rehoboam’s harsh rule, saying 'What portion have we in David?' and separated, causing a division (10:16-19).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 10 teach us about the biblical virtue of humility in leadership?
options: Humility involves listening and responding kindly to those we lead
Humility is not necessary for kings
Humility means always saying yes to everyone
questions.correctAnswer: Humility involves listening and responding kindly to those we lead
questions.explanation: The older men advised Rehoboam to be kind and please the people (10:7), modeling humility in leadership. Rehoboam’s failure to do so led to division.

questions.question: What biblical principle about integrity in work and leadership can be drawn from 2 Chronicles 10:18?
options: Leaders should treat everyone with respect to avoid conflict
Leaders must demand tribute harshly to be effective
Ignoring poor treatment of others is acceptable
Violence is the best way to solve disputes
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders should treat everyone with respect to avoid conflict
questions.explanation: Rehoboam sent Hadoram to collect tribute, but he was stoned to death (10:18), showing how poor treatment or harsh demands can provoke violent backlash, teaching leaders to act with integrity and respect.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Rehoboam told the people, 'My little finger shall be ______ than my father's loins.'
questions.correctAnswer: thicker
questions.explanation: In verse 10, Rehoboam said his little finger would be thicker than his father's loins, indicating he planned to make their burdens heavier.

questions.question: What biblical truth about family leadership and legacy can be learned from 2 Chronicles 10?
options: A leader's attitude toward people affects the legacy of the family or house
Family legacy is not affected by leadership
Leadership style does not impact the community
Only the first generation matters in legacy
questions.correctAnswer: A leader's attitude toward people affects the legacy of the family or house
questions.explanation: The people said, 'What portion have we in David?' and told David to watch his own house (10:16), showing how Rehoboam’s harshness affected the legacy of David’s house negatively.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 10.

questions.question: Where did Rehoboam go to be made king over Israel, according to 2 Chronicles 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Shechem
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 10:1 states that Rehoboam went to Shechem because all Israel had come there to make him king.

questions.question: Who returned from Egypt upon hearing that Rehoboam was to be made king?
questions.correctAnswer: Jeroboam, son of Nebat
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:2 describes that Jeroboam, who had fled to Egypt, returned when he heard the news.

questions.question: What did the people request Rehoboam to do in order to serve him?
options: Ease the grievous servitude his father had put upon them
questions.correctAnswer: Ease the grievous servitude his father had put upon them
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 10:4 explains that the people asked Rehoboam to lighten the heavy yoke his father Solomon had placed on them.

questions.question: Rehoboam consulted two groups before responding to Israel. Who were they?
options: Old men who advised Solomon and young men raised with Rehoboam
questions.correctAnswer: Old men who advised Solomon and young men raised with Rehoboam
questions.explanation: Verses 6-9 describe Rehoboam seeking counsel from the old men who served Solomon and then the young men who grew up with him.

questions.question: What was the advice given by the old men to Rehoboam?
options: Be kind and speak good words to please the people
Increase the yoke and punish harsher
questions.correctAnswer: Be kind and speak good words to please the people
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:7 records the old men advising Rehoboam to be kind and please the people so they would serve him forever.

questions.question: How did the young men advise Rehoboam to respond to the people's request?
options: Make their yoke heavier and chastise them harsher
Grant their request and reduce taxes
Call for a council of elders
questions.correctAnswer: Make their yoke heavier and chastise them harsher
questions.explanation: Verses 10-11 show the young men told Rehoboam to say his little finger would be thicker than his father's loins and that he would punish them with scorpions, meaning more severe chastisement.

questions.question: What specific imagery did Rehoboam use to describe how he would punish the people compared to his father?
questions.correctAnswer: Whips versus scorpions
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 10:11 and 10:14, Rehoboam says his father chastised with whips, but he would chastise with scorpions, indicating harsher punishment.

questions.question: What was the reaction of Israel when Rehoboam rejected the counsel of the old men and increased their burden?
options: They said, 'What portion have we in David?' and went to their tents
They accepted his rule without question
They asked for a second meeting
questions.correctAnswer: They said, 'What portion have we in David?' and went to their tents
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 10:16 records Israel's response rejecting Rehoboam and saying they had no inheritance in David, returning to their tents.

questions.question: True or False: The cause of Rehoboam not listening to the people was ultimately attributed to God fulfilling His word through Ahijah the Shilonite.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 10:15 states that the reason Rehoboam did not listen was because it was God's will to fulfill what was spoken by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam.

questions.question: Which group remained under Rehoboam's reign after Israel's rebellion?
options: The children of Judah dwelling in the cities
questions.correctAnswer: The children of Judah dwelling in the cities
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 10:17 records that Rehoboam reigned over the children of Israel in the cities of Judah after the rebellion.

questions.question: What happened to Hadoram, whom Rehoboam sent over the tribute?
options: He was stoned to death by the children of Israel
He was made king over Israel
questions.correctAnswer: He was stoned to death by the children of Israel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:18 states that Hadoram was stoned by the children of Israel when sent to collect tribute.

questions.question: The term 'scorpions' used in Rehoboam's speech symbolizes what?
options: More severe punishment than his father’s whips
questions.correctAnswer: More severe punishment than his father’s whips
questions.explanation: In verses 2 Chronicles 10:11 and 10:14, 'scorpions' metaphorically represent harsher discipline compared to the 'whips' of Solomon.

questions.question: How does the rejection of Rehoboam by Israel contrast with the Davidic covenant theme seen elsewhere in Scripture?
options: Israel rejects the Davidic line, highlighting the covenant's conditional aspects
It affirms the unconditional promise of David’s everlasting throne
It shows immediate unity under Rehoboam's rule
It reflects the fulfillment of the new covenant in Jeremiah
questions.correctAnswer: Israel rejects the Davidic line, highlighting the covenant's conditional aspects
questions.explanation: The rejection in 2 Chronicles 10:16 contrasts with the Davidic covenant’s promise by showing Israel's conditional loyalty, a theme echoed in 1 Kings 12 and elsewhere.

questions.question: Which prophetic figure is referenced as having spoken about Jeroboam’s rise in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Ahijah the Shilonite
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 10:15 mentions Ahijah the Shilonite who prophesied Jeroboam's rise, showing intertextual prophetic fulfillment.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in the contrasting counsel Rehoboam receives from the old men and the young men?
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm
questions.explanation: The structure of advice from old men (kindness) contrasted with young men (harshness) forms a chiastic pattern highlighting thematic tension in verses 6-14.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the initial request of the people of Israel to Rehoboam when they came to make him king?
options: Ease the grievous servitude that Solomon put upon us
Increase the tax burden on us
Build a new temple in Shechem
questions.correctAnswer: Ease the grievous servitude that Solomon put upon us
questions.explanation: The people asked Rehoboam to ease the heavy yoke and grievous servitude that Solomon his father had put upon them (2 Chronicles 10:4). This request reflects their desire for relief from harsh rule. Similarly, Exodus 1:9-10 shows people's concern about burdensome leadership, and in Acts 5:29, believers stand for just authority, showing the biblical balance between submission and justice.

questions.question: Whose counsel did Rehoboam reject when deciding how to respond to the people?
options: The old men who served Solomon
The young men who grew up with him
questions.correctAnswer: The old men who served Solomon
questions.explanation: Rehoboam forsook the counsel of the old men who advised kindness and pleasing the people, instead choosing the advice of the young men (2 Chronicles 10:8-9). This rejection of wise counsel is echoed in Proverbs 1:7 and 12:15, which warn against ignoring wisdom. James 1:5 encourages seeking godly wisdom, contrasting Rehoboam's folly.

questions.question: How did the young men advise Rehoboam to respond to the people's request?
options: Negotiate a compromise with the elders
questions.correctAnswer: Increase their burdens and chastisement
questions.explanation: The young men advised Rehoboam to tell the people that his little finger would be thicker than his father's loins and that he would add to their yoke and chastise them with scorpions (2 Chronicles 10:10-11). This harsh response reveals human pride and rebellion against God's intended justice. Romans 13:1-4 teaches that rulers are God's servants to punish evildoers, but here Rehoboam abuses authority, highlighting the sinfulness of prideful leadership.

questions.question: What was God's purpose in allowing Rehoboam to ignore the people's request and respond harshly?
options: To fulfill His word spoken through Ahijah concerning Jeroboam
To punish Rehoboam for his sins
To test the loyalty of Israel
To bring about a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: To fulfill His word spoken through Ahijah concerning Jeroboam
questions.explanation: The text states that the cause was of God so that the LORD might perform His word spoken by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam (2 Chronicles 10:15). This shows divine sovereignty over human rebellion, consistent with God's covenant faithfulness seen in Genesis 12:3 and Isaiah 46:9-10. God's providential control is also affirmed in Romans 8:28.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the people of Israel when Rehoboam refused to lighten their burdens?
options: They declared, 'What portion have we in David?' and returned to their tents
They accepted his rule with resignation
questions.correctAnswer: They declared, 'What portion have we in David?' and returned to their tents
questions.explanation: The people responded by rejecting Rehoboam's rule, saying they had no inheritance in David, and each went to his own tent (2 Chronicles 10:16). This rejection marked a significant schism in Israel's history, illustrating the consequences of unfaithful leadership. Similarly, in Jeremiah 7:24-26, Israel's rebellion leads to exile, showing a pattern of covenant unfaithfulness. Acts 7:51 also rebukes rejecting God's messengers.

questions.question: Which cities remained loyal to Rehoboam after the division of Israel?
options: The cities of Benjamin and Dan
questions.correctAnswer: The cities of Judah
questions.explanation: The chapter states that Rehoboam reigned over the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah (2 Chronicles 10:17). This division illustrates the partial fulfillment of God's judgment and the continuation of the Davidic line. Theological significance lies in God's covenant promises to David (2 Samuel 7:12-16) and the messianic hope continuing through Judah (Genesis 49:10).

questions.question: What happened to Hadoram, the overseer of tribute sent by Rehoboam to Israel?
options: He was stoned to death by the Israelites
He negotiated peace between Israel and Judah
questions.correctAnswer: He was stoned to death by the Israelites
questions.explanation: Hadoram was stoned by the Israelites, causing Rehoboam to flee to Jerusalem (2 Chronicles 10:18). This act of violence reflects the deep division and rejection of David's house, highlighting human sinfulness and rebellion against rightful authority. It parallels other biblical instances of rebellion such as Korah's uprising (Numbers 16). Romans 13:1-4 teaches respect for governing authorities ordained by God, contrasting this violent rejection.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Rehoboam said to the people, 'My father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: scorpions
questions.explanation: Rehoboam's harsh reply included the metaphor of chastising with scorpions, indicating more severe oppression than his father (2 Chronicles 10:11). This demonstrates human pride and rejection of wise counsel, contrasting with God's justice and mercy (Micah 6:8). The New Testament teaches leaders to serve humbly (Mark 10:42-45), opposing Rehoboam's oppressive attitude.

questions.question: Who was the prophet whose word God fulfilled through the division caused by Rehoboam's harsh rule?
questions.correctAnswer: Ahijah the Shilonite
questions.explanation: The LORD fulfilled His word spoken by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam (2 Chronicles 10:15). Ahijah prophesied the division of the kingdom (1 Kings 11:29-39), showing God's sovereign plan despite human sin. This prophecy aligns with God's faithfulness to His covenant and judgment on disobedience, consistent with prophetic themes throughout Scripture (Jeremiah 1:10; Ezekiel 37:24-25).

questions.question: What does Rehoboam’s rejection of wise counsel teach about human leadership and sin?
options: It exemplifies the dangers of pride and ignoring godly wisdom
It shows the necessity of harsh discipline
It validates the rule of kings over the people
questions.correctAnswer: It exemplifies the dangers of pride and ignoring godly wisdom
questions.explanation: Rehoboam’s choice to reject the elders' counsel and accept the young men’s harsh advice illustrates the sin of pride leading to folly (2 Chronicles 10:8-14). Proverbs 16:18 warns that pride goes before destruction, and James 4:6 emphasizes God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble. Biblical leadership requires humility and seeking godly counsel (1 Timothy 3:2-7).

questions.question: What theological theme is highlighted by the division of Israel after Rehoboam’s harsh response?
options: The failure of all human kings
The end of the Davidic covenant
questions.correctAnswer: God’s sovereign judgment on unfaithfulness
questions.explanation: The division is portrayed as God's judgment because of Solomon’s and Rehoboam’s failure to govern justly (2 Chronicles 10:15). This theme of divine judgment for covenant unfaithfulness is consistent with Deuteronomy 28 and the prophetic literature (Hosea 4:1-6). Yet, God’s covenant with David remains intact (2 Samuel 7), showing His faithfulness despite human failure.

questions.question: Why did all Israel say, 'What portion have we in David?' after Rehoboam’s answer?
options: Because they rejected Rehoboam’s leadership and the Davidic dynasty
Because they wanted to follow Solomon instead
Because they sought to return to Egypt
Because they desired a new temple in Shechem
questions.correctAnswer: Because they rejected Rehoboam’s leadership and the Davidic dynasty
questions.explanation: The people’s declaration in 2 Chronicles 10:16 reflects their rejection of Rehoboam and symbolic break from the Davidic covenant leadership. This schism reveals human rejection of God’s anointed leaders, similar to Israel’s rejection of prophets (1 Kings 19:10). Yet, God’s ultimate promise of a Messiah from David’s line remains (Luke 1:32-33).

questions.question: How does this chapter illustrate the biblical principle of divine sovereignty in human affairs?
options: God uses even human rebellion to accomplish His purposes
God is powerless against human pride
Human decisions are completely independent of God’s will
God only intervenes in miraculous ways
questions.correctAnswer: God uses even human rebellion to accomplish His purposes
questions.explanation: Verse 15 states the cause was of God so that He might perform His word, showing divine sovereignty over human sin and rebellion. This aligns with biblical teaching in Genesis 50:20 and Romans 8:28 where God works through human actions to fulfill His redemptive plan, demonstrating His providential rule.

questions.question: What does Rehoboam’s flight to Jerusalem after Hadoram’s death signify the political and spiritual state of Judah?
options: A fragile and threatened rule dependent on God’s providence
A theocracy ruled solely by priests
questions.correctAnswer: A fragile and threatened rule dependent on God’s providence
questions.explanation: Rehoboam fleeing after the death of his officer (2 Chronicles 10:18) reflects the instability and fragility of his reign. This event highlights the consequences of sinful leadership and the need for reliance on God’s providence (Psalm 20:7; Proverbs 21:1). Spiritual leadership must be humble and reliant on God’s guidance (John 15:5).

questions.question: What doctrinal truth about sin and leadership can be drawn from Rehoboam’s harsh response and its consequences?
options: Pride and harshness in leadership lead to division and judgment
Harsh discipline is necessary for order
Leaders are never held accountable by God
Human wisdom is superior to godly counsel
questions.correctAnswer: Pride and harshness in leadership lead to division and judgment
questions.explanation: Rehoboam’s prideful refusal to heed wise counsel and harsh treatment of the people led to the kingdom’s division and God’s judgment (2 Chronicles 10:13-14). Scripture consistently warns against pride (Proverbs 16:18) and commands leaders to shepherd God’s people with humility (1 Peter 5:2-3). This chapter illustrates the consequences of sinful leadership on God’s people.
